alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:55PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will continue to impact portions of northeastern Stevens and east central Ferry Counties through 630 PM PDT... At 554 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Colville, or 62 miles northwest of Priest River, moving east at 25 mph. This storm has a history of producing hail up to 0.50 inches. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colville, Kettle Falls, Marcus, Davis Lake, Boyds, and Evans. This includes U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 227 and 252. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
